intro: Aegiphila medullosa, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of purple and pink. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Aegiphila medullosa is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal environments.
